result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby H Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

miscConds.notes: Pay DNA surcharge during term of probation or civil judgment. Court waives all other costs, fees and surcharges due to indigency.
No further violations of the law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobby H Clark

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court ordered SENTENCE WITHHELD and placed the defendant on probation for  12 months with the following conditions:
 - No further violations of the law. 
 - Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
 - Defendant to pay DNA surcharge during term of probation or civil judgment.  Court waives all other costs, fees and surcharges due to indegency.

Defendant Bobby H Clark in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that the defendant thought his court appearance was at 1:30 pm today.  Defense requests court to withdraw bench warrant.  Court orders bench warrant withdrawn.  Parties proceed with plea and sentencing.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing.  The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  No bail forfeited.

Defendant Bobby H Clark in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing.  Court is in trial.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Lamke in court requesting a new plea/sentencing date due to defendant's new job.  No objection from state.  Case now scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing on 06-15-2015 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Bobby H Clark in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case held off the record.  Defendant would like time to view the squad video before resolving this case.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-14-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bobby H Clark in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case held off the record.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-25-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Bobby H Clark in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Bobby H Clark in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
